function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Sick leave policies may not be flexible and consistent with public health guidance, leading to potential spread of contagious diseases in the construction industry.","Impact":"Increased risk of contagious diseases spreading among construction workers and to the wider community.","Mitigation":"Implement flexible and consistent sick leave policies aligned with public health guidance, and ensure all individuals are aware of these policies.","Technologies":"Employee communication platforms, health and safety training programs, digital health monitoring systems.","People":"Construction workers, temporary workers, and their families.","Owner":"Construction companies, firms that provide contract or temporary workers."},{"Description":"Lack of communication with firms that provide contract or temporary workers about the importance of sick employees staying home, leading to potential spread of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Increased risk of contagion within the construction workforce and potential transmission of diseases to other workers and customers.","Mitigation":"Engage in proactive communication with firms about the importance of sick employees staying home and encourage the development of nonpunitive leave policies.","Technologies":"Digital communication platforms, health and safety training programs.","People":"Construction companies, firms providing contract or temporary workers.","Owner":"Construction companies, firms that provide contract or temporary workers."},{"Description":"Failure to consider the concerns of workers related to pay, leave, safety, and health, leading to lower compliance with health and safety guidelines and increased risk of contagion.","Impact":"Reduced adherence to health and safety measures, leading to higher risk of contagious diseases spreading among construction workers and the wider community.","Mitigation":"Take into account the concerns of workers by maintaining flexible policies related to pay, leave, safety, and health, and addressing their concerns through open communication and support.","Technologies":"Employee communication platforms, digital health monitoring systems.","People":"Construction workers, temporary workers.","Owner":"Construction companies."},{"Description":"Lack of information provided to workers and customers about medical care in the event of a COVID-19 outbreak, leading to potential confusion and lack of preparedness.","Impact":"Increased risk of unpreparedness and uncertainty in the event of a COVID-19 outbreak, potentially leading to further spread of the disease.","Mitigation":"Work with insurance companies and state and local health agencies to provide clear and accurate information about medical care in the event of a COVID-19 outbreak.","Technologies":"Digital communication platforms, health information systems.","People":"Construction workers, customers.","Owner":"Construction companies, insurance companies, state and local health agencies."},{"Description":"Tasks with high exposure risk to COVID-19 may not be properly identified and managed, leading to potential exposure and spread of the disease among construction workers.","Impact":"Increased risk of COVID-19 transmission within the construction industry and to the wider community.","Mitigation":"Implement measures to identify and manage tasks with high exposure risk, such as providing appropriate personal protective equipment and enforcing physical distancing and hygiene measures.","Technologies":"Digital health monitoring systems, task management tools, health and safety training programs.","People":"Construction workers, site visitors, members of the public.","Owner":"Construction companies, health and safety management teams."}]}
